thread.title: Kane gets first goal as Sabres beat Leafs in shootout
thread.title_full: Kane gets first goal as Sabres beat Leafs in shootout

title: Kane gets first goal as Sabres beat Leafs in shootout
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Kane gets first goal as Sabres beat Leafs in shootout Evander Kane tied it with 4:29 left with his first goal for Buffalo and the Sabres beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 2-1 in a shootout Wednesday night. Post to Facebook Kane gets first goal as Sabres beat Leafs in shootout Evander Kane tied it with 4:29 left with his first goal for Buffalo and the Sabres beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 2-1 in a shootout Wednesday night. Check out this story on WGRZ.com: http://on.wgrz.com/1LNbfof Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Kane gets first goal as Sabres beat Leafs in shootout Associated Press 10:36 p.m. EDT October 21, 2015 Oct 21, 2015; Buffalo, NY, USA; Buffalo Sabres left wing Matt Moulson (26) celebrates after scoring the winning goal against the Toronto Maple Leafs during the shootout at First Niagara Center. Sabres beat the Leafs 2-1 in a shootout. Mandatory Credit: Kevin Hoffman-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Kevin Hoffman, Kevin Hoffman-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BUFFALO, N.Y. (AP) - Evander Kane tied it with 4:29 left with his first goal for Buffalo and the Sabres beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 2-1 in a shootout Wednesday night. 
Matt Moulson and Tyler Ennis scored in the shootout, while Chad Johnson made 23 saves as Buffalo improved to 2-4. 
P.A. Parenteau scored and Jonathan Bernier made 34 saves as the Maple Leafs fell to 1-3-2. 
Buffalo got off to a fast start, but it was Parenteau who opened the scoring when he redirected Roman Polak's shot from the right point over Johnson's shoulder at the 1:28 mark. 
Kane pushed a wrister past Bernier on Buffalo's 33rd shot of the night. Buffalo traded for Kane last February, but he didn't debut with the Sabres until this season after undergoing shoulder surgery. 
The game went to 3-on-3 overtime, where Buffalo quickly had a 3-on-1 foiled by Bernier.
